about_us: Here in NUS Archery, we practice mainly target archery, comprising of recurve and compound archery. Set at distances ranging from 18m - 70m using target faces ranging from 40cm - 122cm.

We host bi-annual exposure events such as Beginner Archery Courses and Funshoots which are catered to NUS students of all skills level. We also host the annual NUS Indoor Archery Competition where both local and international archers come to compete. As an archer of NUS Archery, you also get the opportunity to participate in many archery competitions, be it local or international!

Our intake for new members will be in Semester 1 of every academic year, incoming members can expect initial physical conditioning training prior to actual shooting. Also, the club can provide beginner level equipment for trainings but we recommend you to purchase your own equipment eventually.
No prior experience is required to join the club, anyone is free to join the archery family. If you are an experienced archer, just reach out to us and we will fill you in!
Interested to find out more? Talk to us now at archery@nussportsclub.org!

events.event_description: Join us on 24 & 31 Aug (Zone A), 26 Aug & 2 Sep (Zone C) and 27 Aug & 3 Sep (Zone B) from 3 - 6 pm to learn more about Archery! Follow us on our social media to stay updated!
Join us on 17 Aug (Zone A), 19 Aug (Zone C) and 20 Aug (Zone B) from 3 - 4 pm or 5 - 6 pm to learn more about Archery! Follow us on our social media to stay updated!
Interested to find out more? Join us on our Zoom session at 8 pm!

A major archery competition with participants from both local and overseas archery clubs, including Malaysia and Thailand to interact and compete with one another. Not confident in competing? Join our archery tag event simply to have fun!
IDS is here! Sign up now and learn how to handle a bow and shoot an arrow! Course is held from W2 to W5, weekly Tues or Thurs depending on which session you picked.

Annual Fun shoot sessions for the campus, from students to staff. Ideal for beginners with no prior experience in Archery with the aims of introducing Archery and providing basic skills to begin their foray into the sport.
